topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537ebbe463687211de040000#post_537ebbe463687211de040000

"Frankly, your elitist, civilized ideals appall me. I recall the days when my neighbors and I would forage in the woods for food, fend off wolf and bear attacks, laugh at the fire shadows for entertainment, fling our shit at our enemies, and club to death anyone who questioned the existence of the all-powerful sky-god Grodd. By Grodd, THOSE were the days."

i love onion commenters

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537ebdb763687237e5250000#post_537ebdb763687237e5250000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537ebcac636872116d380000#post_537ebcac636872116d380000
I've always wondered.
As you know I am kinda anti-gay marriage (wait) because the only reason for wanting it is to get the goodies marriage gets.
Which I don't think should exist.

If I ran a country, gays would be allowed to live together and be the equivalent of married legally... but it may not be called marriage, it would simply recognize marriage and any partnership. What is called marriage would be a social contract.

So I always wondered, if that were suggested as a compromise would that be good enough?[/bq]
No. It's not about benefits it's about basic human rights

Cause if you refuse for the last several thousand years to compromise doesn't it sound fair that when the group that's been losing starts beating the living shit out of you for them to refuse to compromise in reverse?  If they wanted a compromise to which you refuse doesn't it sound fair for them to refuse to compromise when you start getting the shit beaten out of you?

If you ran a country I think you would not be too far off from the man in your avatar. I would legalize marriage between anyone regardless of gender, it _is_ about human rights; you should be able to love whoever you want and not have the government regulating your personal private life.
